layerItems.description:
OpenEmbedded-Core is a layer containing the core metadata for current versions
of OpenEmbedded. It is distro-less (can build a functional image with
DISTRO = "nodistro") and contains only emulated machine support.
layerItems.name: openembedded-core

layerItems.description: The official OpenEmbedded/Yocto BSP layer for Texas Instruments platforms.
layerItems.name: meta-ti-bsp
layerItems.summary: The official OpenEmbedded/Yocto BSP layer for Texas Instruments platforms.

layerItems.description: This repository contains the Arm layers for OpenEmbedded.
layerItems.name: meta-arm
layerItems.summary: This repository contains the Arm layers for OpenEmbedded.

U-Boot, a boot loader for Embedded boards based on PowerPC, ARM, MIPS and several other processors, which can be installed in a boot ROM and used to initialize and test the hardware or to download and run application code.
recipes.inherits: cml1 deploy kernel-arch pkgconfig python3-dir python3native ti-secdev uboot-config uboot-extlinux-config uboot-sign
recipes.summary: u-boot bootloader for TI devices

Mesa is an open-source implementation of the OpenGL specification - a system for rendering interactive 3D graphics.  A variety of device drivers allows Mesa to be used in many different environments ranging from software emulation to complete hardware acceleration for modern GPUs. Mesa is used as part of the overall Direct Rendering Infrastructure and X.org environment.
recipes.inherits: features_check gettext meson meson-routines pkgconfig python3-dir python3native qemu siteinfo
recipes.summary: A free implementation of the OpenGL API  (with PowerVR support for TI platforms)
